p: A vaccine is urgently desired to prevent COVID-19 and thus stall the complications and deaths occurring from community transmission of the infection ( 12). Several COVID-19 vaccines are under clinical trials ( https://www.who.int/docs/default-source/coronaviruse/novel-coronavirus-landscape-covid-19cf1952c105464714aaaf8c7cd5c5cc8b.pdf?sfvrsn=d6073093_5&download=true). It is very important to ensure the immunogenicity, and safety of any vaccine before it is licensed. The most recent vaccine candidate produced by Oxford University called ChAdOx1 nCoV-19 is now in the last phase of clinical trials and has shown optimistic results ( 13).
